intro: Serpocaulon × rojasianum, commonly known as the hybrid serpocaulon, is a rare and unique plant species within the family Bromeliaceae. It is a hybrid between Serpocaulon alatum and Serpocaulon rojasianum, exhibiting a combination of morphological traits from both parent species. The plant is characterized by its compact rosette structure and vibrant, strap-like leaves that can display striking color variations. It thrives in shaded, humid environments, often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Due to its rarity and specific habitat requirements, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists alike.
